pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors
Class ComplexVector

java.lang.Object
  pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.Vector
      pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.ComplexVector

public class ComplexVector
extends Vector

Complex number implementation of Vector. Vectors come in three representations, sparse polar, dense polar, and Cartesian. Superposition and similarity measurement are different for Cartesian and dense polar vectors. The preferred operators and measures is currently chosen by setting the DOMINANT_MODE at compile time.

Author:
devinel

generateRandomVector

public ComplexVector generateRandomVector(int dimension,
                                          int numEntries,
                                          java.util.Random random)
Generates a basic sparse vector in Polar form with the format { offset, phaseAngle, offset, phaseAngle, ... } Consequently the length of the offsets array is 2 X numEntries.

Specified by:
generateRandomVector in class Vector
Parameters:
dimension - number of dimension of vector returned
numEntries - number of non-zero entries, usually a combination of +/-1 entries as determined by implementation
random - random seed for generation
Returns:
Sparse representation of vector in Polar form.

measureCartesianOverlap

protected double measureCartesianOverlap(ComplexVector other)
Measure overlap using the scalar product of cartesian form.

measurePolarDenseOverlap

protected double measurePolarDenseOverlap(ComplexVector other)
Measures overlap of two vectors using mean cosine of difference of phase angles. Transforms this and other vector to POLAR_DENSE representations.

normalize

public void normalize()
Description copied from class: Vector
Transforms vector to a normalized representation. A normalized representation should satisfy the property that measureOverlap with itself is equal to 1.0, to within precision tolerances.

Specified by:
normalize in class Vector

normalizeCartesian

protected void normalizeCartesian()
Normalizes the cartesian form of the vector so that it has unit length. Same as the real vector implementation (except that dimension is doubled).

superpose

public void superpose(Vector other,
                      double weight,
                      int[] permutation)
Description copied from class: Vector
Superposes other vector onto this one with given weight, usually by vector addition. Coordinates of other vector may be permuted and reweighted in the process. Permuted coordinates supports encoding of order information, as begun by Sahlgren, Holst and Kanerva 2008.

Specified by:
superpose in class Vector
Parameters:
other - vector to be added
weight - multiple of other vector added (TODO dwiddows support complex weights)
permutation - represents the purmutation to be applied while adding, so that the ith coordinate of other is added to the coordinate given by the ith entry in this list. Can be NULL in which case no permutation is applied.

toCartesian

public void toCartesian()
Transform from any mode to cartesian coordinates.

public void toDensePolar()
Transform from any mode to cartesian coordinates.

convolve

public void convolve(ComplexVector other,
                     int direction)
Convolves this vector with the other. If the value of direction <= 0 then the correlation operation is performed, ie. convolution inverse

complement

public void complement()
Transforms this vector into its complement. Assumes vector is in dense polar form.
